main.name: Justin Yun
main.bio: Hi there! I am a recent graduate from the University of Colorado Boulder, where I earned my Bachelor's degree in Computer Science. I am currently employed as a Software Engineer at Travelport, where I am able to utilize my knowledge and skills in the field to make a positive impact.

work.title: Software Developer Engineer II
work.description: I led the development of a common framework for test cases and implemented a GitHub branching model for team collaboration. I created load-injection simulators for the Performance Tools Team using Visual C++ and MFC. I developed applications using Java, Spring Boot, and GraphQL, with a focus on leveraging GraphQL over Spring Boot's built-in functions. I successfully reduced technical debt by 78% through focused efforts. I coordinated and executed the migration of projects from TFS to GitHub and implemented a CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions. I established an automated workflow for building and deploying internal tools. I am skilled in working with agile teams and certified in SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework).

work.title: Software Developer Intern
work.description: I developed and enhanced web portals for automated test scheduling and results utilizing ASP Classic, HTML, and CSS, resulting in a 70% reduction in log loading time, optimized automation testing processes by creating a C++ function to modify XML files resulting in an 80% decrease in test execution time, improved user experience by implementing Bootstrap to upgrade the user interface for Travelport's existing codebase, and managed server infrastructure including creating an Excel sheet to track specifications for old and new servers and submitting ServiceNow tickets for each server machine.

work.title: Student Technician (IT)
work.description: I managed the maintenance and upkeep of over 500 classrooms at CU Boulder, ensuring proper functionality of all electronic equipment by conducting regular inspections to guarantee equipment is in optimal working condition, providing prompt assistance to professors experiencing technical difficulties, expertly installing and configuring a wide range of electronic equipment including projectors, microphones, speakers, DVD players, TV's, switchers, and transmitters, and overseeing lab access for faculty and students, ensuring seamless access to necessary resources.

projects.title: First Portfolio
projects.category: A static portfolio that was made with HTML/CSS and hosted with GitHub.

projects.title: Virtual Reality Drone Game
projects.category: Control a physical drone with VR

projects.title: Pokemon Catan
projects.category: Made with QT Studio and C++
